means: 粗糙的，粗硬的，起老茧的
（使）硬结，（使）起茧( callous的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: His hands were rough and calloused, from years of karate practice.
sentence.Network_cn: 由于多年练习空手道，他的双手粗糙不平，布满老茧。

sentence.Network_en: A most practical and emotionally calloused Youth interrupted.

sentence.Network_en: McTeague exhibited his hard , calloused palms.
sentence.Network_cn: 麦克梯格摊开那双生满老茧坚硬的手掌.

entry.def: A foot or hand that is calloused is covered in calluses.

means.word_mean: 1. having skin made tough and thick through wear
